column2: MAINE DMV TEST
Question Text
1. You should increase your following distance when:
column8: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.

column2: 2. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: enter the intersection and then stop.
column10: slow down and enter the intersection.

column2: 3. When is it safe to pass another vehicle?
column4: Whenever signs and/or markings permit passing other vehicles.
column6: When you are entering a curve and there are no oncoming vehicles.
column8: When you are driving through an intersection and there are no oncoming vehicles.

column2: 4. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column6: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column10: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.

column2: 5. When in a vehicle, wear a seat belt:
6. When driving on the freeway behind large trucks, you should:
column6: drive closer behind the truck than for a passenger vehicle.
column8: move to the right of the truck and pass it quickly.

column2: 7. If your wheels drop off the pavement edge, you should:
column4: turn gradually back onto the roadway when safe.
column6: turn back onto the roadway immediately.

column2: 8. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column4: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.
column10: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.

column2: 9. To drive more safely at night:
column6: make sure your headlights are working properly.
column8: don’t drive when you are tired.

column2: 10. You are approaching an intersection with a traffic signal indicating a steady yellow light. If you have not already entered the intersection, you should:
column4: slow down and proceed with caution through the intersection.
column6: stop before entering the intersection if it is safe to do so.
column8: speed up to cross the intersection before the light turns red.

column2: 11. This white sign means you:
column4: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.
column6: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.
column8: may turn left only on a green arrow.

column2: 12. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column6: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
column8: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column10: wait until traffic ahead is clear.

column2: 13. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
14. This road sign means:
15. To make a proper right turn:
column4: swing to the left before turning right.
column6: give the proper signal and get into the lane nearest the right curb.
column8: slow down and get into the lane nearest the centerline.

column2: 16. Signs that indicate a No Passing Zone tell drivers that:
column4: not passing other vehicles is prohibited.
column6: passing is only permitted in daylight hours.
column8: it is not safe to pass.

column2: 17. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
18. This road sign means:
19. If you park facing uphill where there is NO curb, you should set the parking brake and:
column4: turn the wheels toward the edge of the road.
column8: turn the wheels toward the curb.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
31. Drinking alcohol:
column4: has no effect on driving ability but affects your judgement.
column6: improves driving skills but affects your judgement.
column8: has no effect on either judgement or driving  ability.
column10: harms both judgement and driving skills.

column2: 32. If you become sleepy while driving you should:
column8: get some rest or change drivers.

column2: 33. The road is the most slippery:
column6: when it's been raining for 30 minutes or more.
column8: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 34. A broken yellow line between two lanes of traffic means:
column4: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction

column2: 35. When the road is slippery, you should:
column4: use your emergency or parking brake.
column10: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.

column2: 36. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.
column6: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.
column8: accelerate to the speed of traffic.
column10: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.

column2: 37. The best way to deal with tailgaters is to:
column6: let them pass if it's safe to do so.
column8: always keep your eyes focused ahead of your car.

column2: 38. A driver who's being passed on the right and the left by many vehicles while driving in the center lane of an highway should:
column4: move to the lane on their right.
column6: move to the lane on their left.

column2: 39. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
40. To see vehicles in your blind spots, you must look:
41. Drivers should allow a larger space cushion when stopping:
42. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.
43. No Zones are areas around trucks where cars:
column4: disappear into blind spots or are so close to the truck that the driver's ability to stop or maneuver safely is restricted.
column6: can travel behind trucks at constant speed and have no risks of being involved in a collision.
column8: can turn safely because several car lengths have been left between the truck and car.

column2: 44. When passing a motorcycle you must:
column4: give the motorcyclist the entire traffic lane as if the motorcycle was a car.
column6: give the motorcyclist the right hand part of his traffic lane.
column8: sound your horn to alert the motorcyclist.
column10: stay in the right lane as much as possible.

column2: 45. Worn tires:
column4: may cause you to hydroplane even with very little water on the road.

column2: 46. This road sign means:
47. If you see an animal on the road:
column6: pass the animal as fast as possible.

column2: 48. The best way to avoid loss of control in wet conditions is pump your brakes.
49. Night driving can be more difficult because:
column4: there are more cars on the roads at night.
column6: the speed limit is increased at night.
column8: vehicle speed and distance are harder to judge.

column2: 50. This road sign means:
51. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
52. If a bus needs to make a right turn and you are also turning right:
column4: try to turn right before the bus does.
column6: wait until the bus turns before turning right.
column8: squeeze between the bus and the curb.

column2: 53. ________ is the only effective way to reduce your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC).
54. Bicyclists must:
column4: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column6: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column8: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column10: remain near the left edge of the road.

column2: 55. You are stopped behind other vehicles waiting at a stop sign. When the intersection is clear:
column4: you may follow the vehicle ahead without stopping again.
column6: you must stop again at the stop sign.
column8: you may proceed with caution through the intersection without stopping if there is no other traffic.
column10: you must proceed through the intersection without stopping again.

column2: 56. When passing another vehicle, before turning back into the right-hand lane drivers should wait until they can see the vehicle they are passing in the rearview mirror.
57. You arrive at the same time as another vehicle at an intersection has no traffic signs or signals. You should:
column4: speed up and get through the intersection.
column6: sound your horn and drive through the intersection with extreme caution.
column8: drive through the intersection and make the other vehicle stop.
column10: slow down and yield to the vehicle on the right.

column2: 58. This road sign means:
59. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column6: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.
